entries.name: base64digest(str, *args)
entries.desc: Returns the base64 encoded hash value of a given string.  The return value is properly padded with '=' and contains no line feeds.

entries.name: Digest::Class.bubblebabble(string, ...) → hash_stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the BubbleBabble encoded hash value of a given string.

entries.name: Digest::Class.digest(string, *parameters) → hash_stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the hash value of a given string.  This is equivalent to Digest::Instance#new.digest(string), where extra parameters, if any, are passed through to the constructor and the string is passed to digest().

entries.name: file(name, *args)
entries.desc: Creates a digest object and reads a given file, name. Optional arguments are passed to the constructor of the digest class.

entries.name: Digest::Class.hexdigest(string[, ...]) → hash_stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the hex-encoded hash value of a given string.  This is almost equivalent to Digest.hexencode(Digest::Class.new(*parameters).digest(string)).
